com.pump.image.pixel.quantize

Class ColorSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.pixel.quantize.ColorSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ColorSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class stores information about the frequency of colors. This assumes all colors are opaque.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ColorSet.FrequencyComparator
      Sort RGB values in order of frequency.
      static class  ColorSet.RGBChannelComparator
      Sorts RGB values in order of increasing red, green or blue masks.

    • Method Detail

      • getRGBtoFrequencyMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getRGBtoFrequencyMap(boolean cloneData)
        Parameters:
        cloneData - if true then the inner data in this object will be safely cloned. If false then this will return a pointer to the data that backs this object. This may help the efficiency of some algorithms, but of course it needs to be done with caution.
        Returns:
        a map of RGB colors to the number of occurrences of each color.

        public boolean equals(ColorSet l,
                      boolean compareColorsOnly)
        This checks to see if this ColorSet is equal to another.
        Parameters:
        l - another ColorSet to compare against
        compareColorsOnly - if this is true then this method only checks to see that two ColorSets contain the same colors, not necessarily the same pixel count.
        Returns:
        true if two sets are equal

                     int g,

        Parameters:

        g - the green component of this color from [0, 255]
        b - the blue component of this color from [0, 255]
        occurrence - the number of occurrences of this color (must be greater than zero)

      • getPixelCount

        public long getPixelCount()
        Returns:
        the number of pixels represented in this ColorSet.

      • createIndexColorModel

        public java.awt.image.IndexColorModel createIndexColorModel(boolean includeTransparentPixel,
                                                            boolean optimizeForGifs)
        This creates an IndexColorModel. This method does not perform any color reduction: it just converts this data set to a IndexColorModel.

        This method will throw an exception if this set represents over 256 colors (or if this set is over 255 colors and includeTransparentPixel is true.)

        Parameters:
        includeTransparentPixel - if this is true, then the first color in this model will be a transparent pixel.
        optimizeForGifs - if this is true, then the set will be sorted in a way that generally helps GIF compression (the most frequently used colors have the most 0's in them, and if possible the color model is populated with extra shades of the most important colors). If this is false, then this set is simply sorted by descending frequency of color.

        Regardless of this variable, if includeTransparentPixel is true, then this the first index is always the transparent pixel.

        Returns:
        a new IndexColorModel representing this set.

      • addColors

        public void addColors(java.awt.image.BufferedImage i)
        Add all the pixels in this iterator that are more than 50% opaque. This does not account for premultiplied alpha.
        Parameters:
        i - the image to process.

      • addColors

        public void addColors(IntARGBConverter i)
        Add all the pixels in this iterator that are more than 50% opaque. This does not account for premultiplied alpha.
        Parameters:
        i - the pixel data to process.
